item.title: Report E-2025070361
item.description:
Report E-2025070361

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-14
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While doing a site walk at Veolia's ten day in transit facility in Westland, MI, a strong odor was noted. The Veolia team suspected the smell originated from trailer W18938 which had been brought over late Friday evening 1500 (7/11/25) and was on it's way to the disposal facility. After further investigation a wet stain was found along with a strong solvent aroma in the dock well of Dock 2. The stain in the dock well led directly to the storm drain which had the same strong odor. Determining the issue was related to the load, the driver was immediately contacted. The driver pulled over the van trailer at a rest-area to inspect the shipment. It was confirmed that there were no active leaks occurring. After inspecting the shipping papers and the load, only 4 containers were identified as containing liquid material (1 x 55 gallon drum and 3 x 5 gallon carboys). The driver inspected all 4 containers and overpacked the 1 55 gallon drum and 1 carboy. The 55 gallon drum was determined to be leaking. The carboy was overpacked as a proactive measure due to poor integrity of the container. The State of Michigan was contacted through the PEAS system - and a report was filed with Michigan EGLE # 34083. Veolia employees at the Westland site cleaned any potential contaminants from the storm drain and dock area. The work included using floor dry on the hard surfaces and vacuuming out any residual in the storm drain and cleaning the surfaces inside. A sample of the drain will be pulled and sent for analytical testing. All clean up materials will be disposed of properly.

item.title: Report E-2025070385
item.description:
Report E-2025070385

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-06
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 6, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon jugs of SaniDate 5.0 were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the site. SET personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a cleaning agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN3109 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025070359
item.description:
Report E-2025070359

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 2, 2025, one (1) 20-liter jerrican of UN3264 was forked and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior, dock floor, and asphalt R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the product impacted areas. Hand tools were utilized to retrieve all placed absorbents. ES utilized a pressure washing unit to prevent any product staining. All damaged product, and spent absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and two (2) 30-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report E-2025070367

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While removing a 55 gallon drum from a box van using a fork truck, the fork truck operator punctured the drum of flammable material with the forks. The resulting spill happened on a concreted floor inside the building and was quickly contained. The drum was quickly overpacked into an 85 gallon drum for continued transportation. The area impacted by the release was cleaned up in house.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2025, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN3260 was forked and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. All loose product was retrieved using a vacuum unit. All damaged bags and retrieved products were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025060502
item.description:
Report E-2025060502

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-02
  • City: WARREN
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1836 ET, XPO, notified ERTS of a cargo release at XPN. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Potassium Hydroxide Solution released from a plastic pail due to improper loading by the shipper. The release impacted trailer # 4630542 and the concrete at the head of the trailer outside. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of UN1814 Potassium Hydroxide Solution product released to 10x5 area of the wooden trailer floor and concrete due to improper loading. The impacted areas of the floor were treated with sodium bicarb and generated (2) 55-poly drums containing damaged product, rags, absorbents and PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025060413
item.description:
Report E-2025060413

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-29
  • City: WYANDOTTE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: This is a rubber line trailer which has a switch on the rear of the trailer. The switch opens the valve to the chemical hose on top which connects to the customer tank for unloading. This switch was in the open position. When the driver started to air the tank, pressure started building up. Driver did not have the hose connected prior to airing it up. Once the cap was taken off, the product came shooting out.

item.title: Report E-2025060443
item.description:
Report E-2025060443

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-28
  • City: WARREN
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 20:51 PM ET, XPN contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Warren, MI. The spill consists of approximately a quarter of a gallon of Lesonal Medium Reducer, which released from a 1-gallon metal can due to damage that occurred prior to arrival. The can was found leaking inside of the box and on the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and will place the waste into a 20-gallon plastic drum. Waste ID 239248-1 was generated.
